snippet: Researchers report that levels of a substance that is released into the urine when bones weaken can predict the risk for future fracture in premenopausal women.
abstract: Researchers report that levels of a substance that is released into the urine when bones weaken can predict the risk for future fracture in premenopausal women.

headline.main: Urine Test May Predict Women's Bone Risk
headline.print_headline: Vital Signs | Screening: Urine Test May Predict Women’s Bone Risk
